required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Menstrual Cycle Hormones and Eating Behavior
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Menstrual Cycle Hormone Changes on Eating Behavior and Nutrient Metabolism

lead_sponsor.agency: USDA, Western Human Nutrition Research Center

clinical_study.source: USDA, Western Human Nutrition Research Center

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine if the phase of the menstrual cycle (opposed versus unopposed estrogen phase) affects eating behavior, including types of foods preferred, wanting/desire for specific foods, and perception of hunger.

detailed_description.textblock: This is an observational study to investigate the effect of endogenous estrogen (E2) and progesterone (P4) levels on eating behavior and energy-yielding nutrient metabolism. Eating behavior will be assessed during a complete menstrual cycle during the first month of the study. Participants will track the follicular and luteal phases of their menstrual cycle using urinary leuteinizing hormone (LH) kits, they will record information about their food intake, eating behaviors, and appetite in their home environments, and they will complete two laboratory test days: one test day scheduled during their follicular phase, and one test day scheduled during their luteal phase.

primary_outcome.time_frame: At follicular (day 11) and luteal (day 26) phase of menstrual cycle
primary_outcome.description: Eating behavior, including types of foods preferred, wanting/desire for specific foods, and perception of hunger will be measured using four questionnaires; Eating inventory: to assess dietary restraint, Stanford Brief Physical Activity Questionnaire, Food craving questionnaire, Eating behavior and attitudes questionnaire

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At follicular (day 11) and luteal (day 26) phase of menstrual cycle
secondary_outcome.description: To determine if the phase of the menstrual cycle affects insulin sensitivity, we will measure plasma insulin, glucose and non-esterified fatty acids (NEFA).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At follicular (day 11) and luteal (day 26) phase of menstrual cycle
secondary_outcome.description: Blood samples will be analyzed for lipids and lipoproteins, including apoproteins A1, B, C-II, C-III, and E.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At follicular (day 11) and luteal (day 26) phase of menstrual cycle
secondary_outcome.description: The level of urinary C-peptide and creatinine will be measured in a 24-hour urine collection.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At follicular (day 11) and luteal (day 26) phase of menstrual cycle
secondary_outcome.description: Estradiol measured in serum in relation to appetite variables

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At follicular (day 11) and luteal (day 26) phase of menstrual cycle
secondary_outcome.description: Progesterone measured in serum in relation to appetite variables

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At follicular (day 11) and luteal (day 26) phase of menstrual cycle
secondary_outcome.description: Dehydroepiandrosterone measured in serum in relation to appetite variables

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At follicular (day 11) and luteal (day 26) phase of menstrual cycle
secondary_outcome.description: SHBG measured in serum in relation to appetite variables

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At follicular (day 11) and luteal (day 26) phase of menstrual cycle
secondary_outcome.description: Endocannabinoid profile measured in serum to assess appetite

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At follicular (day 11) and luteal (day 26) phase of menstrual cycle
secondary_outcome.description: Leptin measured in serum to assess appetite

biospec_descr.textblock: Serum, plasma and urine samples may be retained for future testing.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Body Mass Index between 20-30 Kg/m2
- regular menstrual cycles
- sedentary lifestyle (physical activity not more than 30 minutes per day three times a week)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Fasting blood sugar greater than 110 mg/dL
- Systolic Blood Pressure greater than 140 mmHg
- Diastolic Blood Pressure greater than 90 mmHg
- Fasting triglycerides greater than 120 mg/dL
- Documented or self-reported chronic disorders such as arthritis, or other inflammatory diseases
- Women who are Post-menopausal or Peri-menopausal
- Pre-menopausal women who are pregnant, uni/multiparous, taking oral contraceptives, or who have menstrual cycles lasting less than 20 days or greater than 45 days, polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS), amenorrhea, eumenorrhoea, or polymenorrhoea.

overall_official.affiliation: USDA, ARS, Western Human Nutrition Research Center

facility.name: USDA, ARS, Western Human Nutrition Research Center
